acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Warren County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Warren County was named for Joseph Warren, the revolutionary patriot who sent Paul Revere and William Dawes on their famous rides and who was killed at the Battle of Bunker Hill. The county was formed from Frederick and Shenandoah counties in 1836.

The County Courts were responsible for the creation and maintenance of the road and bridges in their county. The Court accepted or rejected petitions to create new roads, alter existing roads, or to discontinue roads. They accepted or rejected petitions to build new bridges, replace old bridges, or make repair to existing bridges. The County Government paid for the creation, the alterations, the repairs or replacement of the roads and bridges.

During the Colonial Period and to 1866, the people, owning or renting property on a road or their hands, were responsible for maintaining the road. The County Court appointed "Overseers of the Road" to supervise the work on the road. In an Act of Assembly Passed on February 28, 1866, a County Commission of the Road was appointed to make contracts with contractors to construct roads or bridges and to make the repairs to the roads or bridges. The county was allowed to collect specific levies to pay the contractors for their work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Warren County (Va.) Board of Supervisors Records, 1871-1924 contains Board of Road Commissioners Minutes, Description of Roads in Front Royal District, Plats and Surverys of Roads, Road Contract Book, Road Warrants, Toll Books, and Warrant Book.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Warren County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"

scopecontent.p: There are two boxes of Road Warrants. Box 212 contains Road Warrants, 1893-1902 and Box 213 contains Road Warrants, 1906-1910. Warrents were bills for the work done to the roads.
This is a volume of plats and surveys showing the location of roads in Warren County.

did.unittitle: Description of Roads in Front Royal District, 1883-1890

scopecontent.p: This books gives a description of the condition of the roads.

Pages 1-4 of this book contains the Minutes from the meetings of the Board of Road Commissioners. Pages 140-142 contains accounts of the sale of toll tickets for January 22, 1917-June 20, 1912. Loose papers in the book include a plat and survey of a road, two road petitions, and a two page resolution.
Toll Book, 1916, Volume 1; Toll Book, 1916, Volume 3: Toll Book, 1916, Volume 4; and Toll Book, 1917, Volume 5. These are the records of tolls paid to use a toll road or a toll bridge.
This book contains the contract for work to be done to the roads and bridges within Warren County.
This book contains the bills for work done on the roads and bridges in Warren County.
